person.title: Person
person.description: An individual actor, contact, or owner.

firstName.title: First name
firstName.description:
The first segment of the name in the writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name. In many cultures this is the preferred personal or given name.

The `firstName` and `lastName` properties have been introduced to maintain compatibility with existing systems that model names in a simplified, non-semantic, and non-internationalizable way. Using `xdm:fullName` is always preferable.

lastName.title: Last name
lastName.description:
The last segment of the name in the writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name. In many cultures this is the inherited family name, surname, patronymic, or matronymic name.

The `firstName` and `lastName` properties have been introduced to maintain compatibility with existing systems that model names in a simplified, non-semantic, and non-internationalizable way. Using `xdm:fullName` is always preferable.

middleName.title: Middle name
middleName.description: Middle, alternative, or additional names supplied between the first name and last name.

courtesyTitle.title: Courtesy title
courtesyTitle.description:
Normally an abbreviation of a persons *title*, *honorific*, or *salutation*.
The `courtesyTitle` is used in front of full or last name in opening texts.
e.g Mr. Miss. or Dr J. Smith.

fullName.title: Full name
fullName.description: The full name of the person, in writing order most commonly accepted in the language of the name.

birthDate.title: Birth Date
birthDate.description: The full date a person was born.

birthDayAndMonth.title: Birth Date
birthDayAndMonth.description: The day and month a person was born, in the format MM-DD. This field should be used when the day and month of a person's birth is known, but not the year.

birthYear.title: Birth year
birthYear.description: The year a person was born including the century (yyyy, e.g 1983).  This field should be used when only the person's age is known, not the full birth date.

repositoryCreatedBy.title: Created by User Identifier
repositoryCreatedBy.description: User id who has created the entity.

repositoryLastModifiedBy.title: Modified by User Identifier
repositoryLastModifiedBy.description: User id who last modified the entity. At creation time, `modifiedByUser` is set as `createdByUser`.

createdByBatchID.title: Created by Batch Identifier
createdByBatchID.description: The Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has been originating the creation of the entity.

modifiedByBatchID.title: Modified by Batch Identifier
modifiedByBatchID.description: The last Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has modified the entity. At creation time, `modifiedByBatchID` is set as `createdByBatchID`.

createDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was created in the repository, such as when an asset file is first uploaded or a directory is created by the server as the parent of a new asset. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

modifyDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was last modified in the repository, such as when a new version of an asset is uploaded or a directory's child resource is added or removed. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

_id.title: Coordinates ID
_id.description: The unique identifier of the coordinates.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what the coordinates identify.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The signed vertical coordinate of a geographic point.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The signed horizontal coordinate of a geographic point.

elevation.title: Elevation
elevation.description: The specific elevation of the defined coordinate. The value conforms to the [WGS84](http://gisgeography.com/wgs84-world-geodetic-system/) datum and is measured in meters.

countryCode.title: Country code
countryCode.description: The two-character [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://datahub.io/core/country-list) code for the country.

stateProvince.title: State or province
stateProvince.description: The state, or province portion of the observation. The format follows the [ISO 3166-2 (country and subdivision)][http://www.unece.org/cefact/locode/subdivisions.html] standard.

postalCode.title: Postal code
postalCode.description: The postal code of the location. Postal codes are not available for all countries. In some countries, this will only contain part of the postal code.

dmaID.title: Designated Market Area
dmaID.description: The Nielsen Media Research designated market area.

msaID.title: Metropolitan Statistical Area
msaID.description: The Metropolitan Statistical Area in the USA where the observation occurred.

repositoryCreatedBy.title: Created by User Identifier
repositoryCreatedBy.description: User id who has created the entity.

repositoryLastModifiedBy.title: Modified by User Identifier
repositoryLastModifiedBy.description: User id who last modified the entity. At creation time, `modifiedByUser` is set as `createdByUser`.

createdByBatchID.title: Created by Batch Identifier
createdByBatchID.description: The Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has been originating the creation of the entity.

modifiedByBatchID.title: Modified by Batch Identifier
modifiedByBatchID.description: The last Data Set Files in Catalog Services which has modified the entity. At creation time, `modifiedByBatchID` is set as `createdByBatchID`.

createDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was created in the repository, such as when an asset file is first uploaded or a directory is created by the server as the parent of a new asset. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

modifyDate.description: The server date and time when the resource was last modified in the repository, such as when a new version of an asset is uploaded or a directory's child resource is added or removed. The Date Time property should conform to ISO 8601 standard. An example form is "2004-10-23T12:00:00-06:00".

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Primary address indicator. A Profile can have only one `primary` address at a given point of time.

label.title: Label
label.description: Free form name of the address.

street1.title: Street 1
street1.description: Primary Street level information, apartment number, street number and street name.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region, county, or district portion of the address.

postOfficeBox.title: Post Office Box
postOfficeBox.description: Post office box of the address.

country.title: Country
country.description: The name of the government-administered territory. Other than `xdm:countryCode`, this is a free-form field that can have the country name in any language.

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the address.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

lastVerifiedDate.title: Last Verified Date
lastVerifiedDate.description: The date that the address was last verified as still belonging to the person.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description:
Primary email indicator.

A Profile can have only one `primary` email address at a given point of time.

address.title: Address
address.description: The technical address, e.g 'name@domain.com' as commonly defined in RFC2822 and subsequent standards.

label.title: Label
label.description: Additional display information that maybe available, e.g MS Outlook rich address controls display 'John Smith smithjr@company.uk', the 'John Smith' part is data that would be placed in the label.

type.title: Type
type.description: The way the account relates to the person. e.g 'work' or 'personal'

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the email address.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description:
Primary phone number indicator.

Unlike for Address or EmailAddress, there can be multiple primary phone numbers; one per communication channel.
The communication channel is defined by the type:

* `textMessaging`: type = `mobile`
* `phone`: type = `home` | `work` | `unknown`
* `fax`: type = `fax`

number.title: Number
number.description: The phone number. Note the phone number is a string and may include meaningful characters such as brackets (), hyphens - or characters to indicate sub dialing identifiers like extensions x. E.g 1-353(0)18391111 or +613 9403600x1234.

extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The internal dialing number used to call from a private exchange, operator or switchboard.

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the phone number.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

validity.title: Validity
validity.description: A level of technical correctness of the phone number.

preferredLanguage.title: Preferred Language
preferredLanguage.description: Describes the preferred system of communication used by the profile. Language codes are expressed in BCP 47 format.

emailFormat.title: Email Format
emailFormat.description: Email format preferred by the profile. This can be rich text/plain text

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Describes which time zone the profile is present in, most frequently/the time zone preferred by the profile. Time zones are expressed according to the IETF tz database: https://www.ietf.org/timezones/tzdb-2016i/tz-link.htm

optInOut.title: OptInOut
optInOut.description: Describes a users opting in and out preferences for communication by medium and communication type.

email.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

phone.description: Communication preference for the outbound channel identified through its URL by the name of the property.

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.
meta:enum.out: Opt-Out: the user declines to receive any messages on this channel

meta:enum.in: Opt-In: the user explicitly consents to receiving messages.

globalOptout.title: Global Opt-out
globalOptout.description: Do not contact this profile on any outbound channel.
